Other nearby parking garages I saw were charging $30.00 as their daily rate, so why not pay the difference to the hotel and let them park and bring your car to you) Fabulous exercise room with the latest equipment well maintained with an excellant indoor pool and spa. Very nice touch providing complementary bottled water and Washington State Red Delicious apples at poolside. Well appointed and maintained men's locker room/shower with plenty of towels and various toiletries. Operating hours of the pool/heath club I believe were weekdays it opened at 5:00 A.M weekdays 6:00 A.M weekends, closing at 10:00 P.M. Quite adequate. We did not dine at either Shuckers or the Georgian which are on the property Both restaurants appeared to be very elegent however, and I have no doubts that the food is quite good. For cheapskates such as myself, Bernard's on Seneca just a block from the hotel would be a fine choice for either breakfast or lunch. I will give the room a 4.5 diamond rating. A 5.0 diamond for service, but a 4 diamond room overall. Details follows: Compliments: My wife and stayed in a deluxe king suite on August 6 and August 7. The room itself, the sleeping area, and bathroom are spotless . Nice touch providing bathrobes for guests. Water pressure in the shower while not great is more than adequate. Complementary daily New York TImes and Seattle Times brought to your doorstep each morning.. Housekeeping filling your ice bucket. daily Very classy indeed. Critical comments: The room is somewhat under furnished. A second armchair and ottoman would have been nice for the wife and myself to use to watch television together . it would be nice to have a coffee maker in the room. There is a nearby Starbucks, (they are on practically every major street downtown, along with a Tully's and Seattle Best Coffee also nearby for those of you that may have issues with Starbucks. Then again, not everyone would want to leave the property to get coffee ( I did, because room service prices are simply outrageous, but then that is SOP at all hotels) Hotel location -Fabulous- University Street station is just a couple of blocks away, which offers subway service to Pioneer Square, Chinatown. Mariners/Seahawks stadium and if I am not mistaken, in December 2009 to Seatac airport. . Seattle's public transportation system does have designated "free zones". ie you can ride public transporation for free with limitations. Please ask the hotel about that upon your arrival Pike's market, several block walk away In conclusion, if you are planning to stay in downtown Seattle, and price is not a consideration , this is the place to stay. At times this year I have noticed this is the most expensive property downtown. If price is an object,( for some of us rooms starting at $300.00+ a night + tax+ parking is simply too much money) watch for specials. Be patient. It will be well worth the time and effort. I'm glad I did.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Rapunzelgirl
Reviews.Content: This was truly a 5 star hotel. The staff was very polite and accomidating. The rooms were clean and very nice, best of all were the beds and pillows. I have not selpt that well in a long time. Highly recommend the Olympic Fairmont Hotel in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Wobross
Reviews.Content: We were fed up with hotels on our road trip which just not measure up to their adverts. The Fairmont restored our faith. Excellent suite , fantastic pool and spa and wonderful building. The concierge recommendations for tours and dinners were exactly what we required. I would recommend you splash out and eat in the main restaurant at least once even if only for breakfast and have a massage in the health club.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: D0nk3y
Reviews.Content: The lobby and hotel itself are quite nice. The staff is friendly and very efficient. The service is good and the rooms are clean. We stayed at the hotel using the friends and family rate discount code. Our room was a Queen but the bed is closer to an extended double, definitely not Queen width. The mattress was soft and needed replacing as you could tell it had been well used. The furnishings and decor were outdated. Both the furniture and the carpet in the room were stained and needed replacing. The TV was quite old and large but worked fine. We received a room with bathroom bars and a lifted toilet seat for aiding those with a disability. While this is definitely useful for some, neither of us needed this and the bar above the toilet got in the way. Overall, if you are paying full price you would be better off to stay at a different hotel, the Olympic is not worth full price and the rooms rate closer to 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MarciaB10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seattle Fairmont , during the â€˜heat waveâ€™ of 2009. Living in the Chicago area our whole lives, the 100+ temps with low humidity werenâ€™t bad at all! I got a GREAT rate at the Fairmont for a king suite, through their website about 6-8 weeks prior to our stay. After a one night stay in mid Washington at a beautiful hotel with horrible service it was very nice checking into the Fairmont. Much like Four Seasons, EVERYONE employed there seems to be very well trained in customer service. Greeting you, smiling, saying good morning etc.. without being overbearing. We used the concierge desk often, and everyone there was very helpful and friendly. The hotel itself, was very traditional, which some consider to be outdated, and while some of the dÃ©cor wasnâ€™t my favorite, everyplace was clean and well taken care of. Our room was great, very comfortable bed, with doors separating the seating area from sleeping area. This is great for us, since I always am up very early, especially when we are on the west coast, its great to have a sitting area separate. We did not eat at the hotel, only being there for a few days, with sooo many great restaurants in Seattle, but I did use the fitness center twice. Very nice, lots of equipment, and free to quests. Only minor complaints.. Our room was street side, and there was traffic noise.. But it is a city~ didnâ€™t keep me awake at all. And while our room was very comfortable, the halls were warm, but considering we were there during the hottest time in history, it wasnâ€™t bad. The Fairmont was a perfect location, while in Seattle we never even used our car! Should have just taken it back to the airport and saved on parking.. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kdeveraux
Reviews.Content: I was in town for an employment interview. The company I interviewed with put me up in a less expensive hotel near their offices but I stayed on for several days to explore Seattle. This grand hotel is classic & lovely and the location wonderful. The greenery at the entrance was a serene introduction to the hotel. My room was very clean, although the furniture was a little bit dated. I very much like the bathroom toiletries because they arenâ€™t overly scented. I left my mobile phone charger/converter at the previous hotel, about 15km away. The concierge sent the car to pick it up. Thatâ€™s service! The afternoon tea in the Georgian Room was relaxing, the service very attentive and the food was excellent. It compares to the afternoon teas at the grand hotels of London. I would go back just for the scones.

Reviews.Title: “Grand and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: asianam
Reviews.Content: Our room had views of buildings nearby and it was on a lower floor (4th floor) above the indoor pool. The street noise was noticeable with windows open, but I absolutely appreciate hotels that have windows that open and allow fresh air. Our room was an upgraded suite (bedroom and separate sitting area) and we paid $275/night as part of a meeting group. The king bed was extremely comfortable; you can sink into it without losing the body support. Service throughout was excellent and the dining room and overall facility is a classic beauty. Walking in the downtown and port area was convenient and very safe in the hotel locale. Service was both friendly and attentive. Our rooms were pristine and housekeeping did an double check after the first cleaning of the day. Bathroom amenities were high quality soaps, shampoo and conditioner. This was my third trip to Seattle and this hotel made it the best trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but not Five Star”
Reviews.Author: RTexan
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Seattle last week with my wife for a short vacation. We took the airport shuttle to the Fairmont Olympic hotel -- which arrives at the back entrance. We dragged our luggage into the lobby and checked in at the main desk. The staff was courteous, but I found it strange that no one asked if we needed help with our bags. The room was nice, though the furniture is somewhat dated. We had a room with a king size bed. The room had a sitting area with a sofa, chairs and flat screen TV and a separate bedroom with another flat screen TV. I did not find the problems that others have described, such as leaking sinks or stained and dirty furniture -- everything seemed in good repair. Except for the ironing board, which was a cheap piece of junk. It was flimsy and refused to lock into place until I turned it over on the floor and physically bent the locking mechanism back into place. It collapsed twice before being repaired. I was just glad that I didn't have a hot iron on it when it fell. I did have one issue that might not bother some, but it really bothers me. In an age when everyone has a cell phone, probably a laptop computer and likely a digital camera etc. that needs to be recharged, why don't hotels put some form of power strip on the desk in the hotel room? Our hotel room had a very nice writing desk with a lamp, telephone etc. However, to plug in any sort of charger, you were required to pull the desk out in order to reach the single available outlet back in the corner. Good luck plugging in two things at once, unless you are unplugging something else. No chance finding an outlet that is not behind some heavy piece of furniture. I did get the idea that the hotel is short on staff. The first morning, the promised wake up call never came. One day we stayed in our room past noon and received a phone call from the housekeeping staff to call housekeeping before 10 pm if we wanted to have the room cleaned. I appreciated the fact that they hadn't knocked since we had the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door. We called housekeeping and left a voice mail message at about 2:00 pm that we would like the room cleaned. No one ever showed up to clean the room and we never received a phone call or other message as to why the room could not be cleaned. The concierge desk and the people in the gift shop were very helpful and friendly. All in all a really good hotel with really good service, but a few things that could stand some work and management attention. I would stay here again, but probably not if I had to pay full rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing; super location!”
Reviews.Author: easiliypleased
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just spent overnight at the Fairmont Olympic and are super sorry we didn't stay longer! Did the touristy thing around Seattle and couldn't have had a bettter base from which to start. We had an upgrade to a junior suite that was the cherry on top! Must put a word in about William, their concierge----he gave us info that was perfect for the little time we had!

Reviews.Title: “Fradulant charges horrible management”
Reviews.Author: Kevin040
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights and management was unethical ,unprofesional .Motel 6 probably has better manner and profesionalism. I would be very careful with dealing with this hotel and stay away from them as far as possible! I probably stayed hundreds of hotles all my life but I never ever had worst experience than this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel - Some Pros, Some Cons”
Reviews.Author: wintersummer
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Olympic is a grand old hotel. It's certainly not trendy, and is decorated in a somewhat fussy style - I personally think it could use a little updating, especially to keep up-to-date with all the other hotels in the area. You don't really get the feeling you are in Seattle. Hotel takes up an entire city block and according to staff, very few rooms have views, because you're looking at buildings next to hotel. For that reason, you could really be in any city. We're in executive suite, which is very very spacious! Bedroom, sitting area, dressing area, large bathroom. It's surprising room does not have a coffee pot - but I asked, and they brought us one from room service. That's where this hotel shines - in the service. Every single aspect of service has been excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - great if you can get a cheap rate”
Reviews.Author: rockohorse
Reviews.Content: We got a friends and family rate so it was considerably cheaper than the other hotels downtown seattle. I have to say the location is great - though after walking around i got the impression that seattle downtown is so small you could stay anywhere and it would be convenient. We got upgraded so i'm not sure what a normal room is like, ours was nice and spacious. THe place was pretty good, think the bed was a bit old (common complaint with most faimonts) so a bit springy but not terrible. I liked the gym, its tiny but its got the basics and its in the pool area so there is a nice little atrium. If you are looking for free coffe in the morning it is poolside, i'm not sure why. If you are a part of the fairmont club (free!) then you can use the gym for free. You go down, get earphones for the cardio machines, a towel and a bottle of water. I liekd this place.

Reviews.Title: “A real bed would have been nice”
Reviews.Author: lsjohnsonVancouver
Reviews.Content: After spending an evening out on the town we went to retire to our room and the â€œbedâ€� was horrible absolutely no support at all, and we both kept rolling into the middle and every time one of us moved the entire bed shook and did not feel like it was properly secure. Finally after 3-4 fitful hours of attempted sleep we got up and checked out. Upon checking out at the front desk we waited politely for the girl to ask us how our stay was â€“ it never was brought up. As this was our first stay at a Fairmont hotel it will more than likely be my last as it has left a lasting impression. It was nice to know if you get what they call the "friends & family rate" You get the worst room in the hotel. Parking is $36.00 per day on top of what you pay for your room as well FYI. I also completed a comment card and sent an email to the Fairmont and have not had any response to my concerns, I guess this is how you treat "friends and family"....

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but definitely NOT 5-Star quality”
Reviews.Author: Advantage1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a close 4 blocks from the Convention Center, and the walk to there is great. The bellhops are quite friendly and offer to help with luggage if you'd like. The doors were always opened for me when entering or leaving the Hotel. The staff at the reception counter were quite friendly and fast. The Hotel is also clean. But this is where the compliments stop. The non-smoking room, and the hallway leading to the room smelled like smoke, numerous room furniture items were in need of repair or they were extremely worn, the bathroom sink dripped, the carpet was stained in places as was the couch and desk chair, and the TVs were probably 10 years old with remote batteries needing replacement. There was a single instance of a repairman entering the room without knocking. The hotel was nice enough, but definitely not 5-star quality. Perhaps "3 stars" out of 5 is more appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant, unexpected room amenities, excellent concierge”
Reviews.Author: denitrip
Reviews.Content: This was our first Fairmont Hotel experience and had read all experiences left on Tripadvisor. We enjoyed our stay including the extras that the rooms have, like silk hangers for women's clothing with fragrance sachets, the great toilettries, great shower. They will shine your shoes if you like. We also loved the fact that they have a car at our disposal (at no fee), but did leave a nice tip! The driver dropped us off at several locations throughout our stay and picked us up as well. The driver can only be within the downtown area and that was perfect for us. We had stayed the night prior to leaving on an Alaska cruise and asked the concierge to schedule some activities, including a concert and a car rental upon our return in a week. Everything was waiting for us upon our return. I believe this hotel's service, staff and restaurants are one of the best we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Still Sets the Standard in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: QuakerBoy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay at the Fairmont Olympic and wish I was still there! Great facility in a perfect location with a well trained, very attentive staff. Initially checked in to a newly renovated room (flat screen tv, updated bath, etc.), but it was close to the street and a little noisy for me (but not as bad as the new Four Seasons on First or other hotels), and asked to be moved to a higher room. Ended up on the tenth floor in an "older room," which was perfect and very quiet. I never turned on the TV anyway, so what do I care if it's HD or black and white? Great pool and fitness center; super restaurants; a delightful piano bar in the evenings, and just plain old world charm throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with good location.”
Reviews.Author: nicole4278
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Olympic Hotel June 14-17th for business. My business was at the convention center, which was only about 5 blocks away so this was quite convenient. I booked a deluxe room for a very reasonable price, especially considering wi-fi and ethernet internet was included in the price. The deluxe room had a very comfortable king bed with nice linens and down pillows. By far one of the most comfortable beds I've slepted in for a long time. There is plenty of room for your clothes with drawers and a large closet with many hangers. Robes and slippers are included in the room as are nice quality toiletries. The toiletries include: shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, body lotion, cotton balls and Q-tips. The room also has a safe that can fit a laptop and a good size desk from which you can work. I ordered room service each morning for breakfast and all the food was excellent. The only downside of this room is that a coffee maker is not included. This was a huge disappointment as most rooms that I've stayed in have a coffee maker. The hotel should really consider providing coffee machines in each room or upon request at the least. Note: room service is very expensive. A small breakfast such as oatmeal and a medium pot of coffee ran about $25 with the extra fees they tack on. The fitness center is the best fitness center I've seen at a hotel in a long time. The cardio machines are newer and offer DVD and CD players. The sauna is also a great touch. The lobby is beautiful and the staff very pleasant and helpful. I asked the bellmen many questions about where to find a drugstore, a deli, etc and each time they were polite, helpful and accurate with their directions. Unfortunately, I worked the entire time while in Seattle and didn't get a chance to site see; however, this is a very convenient location if you are traveling on business or pleasure. It's only a few blocks to the convention center, waterfront (Pike's Market) and the monorail, which will take you to the space needle. Overall, I would definitely return to this hotel whether it be for business or pleasure in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiBaroda
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with excellent service. Centrally located but the vallet service is very slow and one has to wait for a while to get their car or give their car for vallet parking. The hotel needs to find another option.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury looks - motel service!”
Reviews.Author: tnt.faircloth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I take several trips a year. Getting away and staying at a luxury hotel is a high priority to us so we reserved three nights in an Executive Suite at what was stated as â€œthe only AAA 5star hotel in Seattleâ€�. The hotel dÃ©cor was clean and provided all that you would expect from the Fairmont chain, however, the service was seriously lacking. More along the lines of a 3star hotel at best. Hereâ€™s the brief on our experience: 1. A/C in suite did not work. They offered us a oscillating fan. After many phone calls and that ate up our evening, they moved us to another room and offered breakfast the next morning. Things would have been fine, but unfortunately, this was only the beginning of the poor service we received during our stay. 2. We asked the Concierge about seafood in the area. He pulled out a book of menus. We looked them over, selected the entrÃ©e we desired and the Conciege gave us directions for the six block walk. Once we arrived at the restaurant, the waiter informed us that the menu displayed at the Fairmont was changed several years ago. Needless to say, the entrÃ©e we wanted was no longer available at the restaurant. 3. I booked a relaxing massage. Upon arrival, I was directed to a room with no air conditioning and loud music / group noise echoing from the pool a few steps outside my door. Not a relaxing environment for a massage! It was very loud and the sweating uncomfortably, I decided to cancel the long awaited massage. 4. Concierge desk told us hotel courtesy car would take us to rental car agency where we rented a car for a day trip. When we went downstairs the valet said the car was out for maintenance. We responded â€“ on a holiday weekend? We found out later they really had two courtesy cars although the other car was never offered. 5. When we returned from our day trip, we spoke to Chris Dulac, evening manager who gave us a condescending â€œI apologizeâ€� for the inconveniences we had encountered and told us the car was now back from the Maintenance shop. It was Memorial Day?â€¦. maintenance shops surely were closedâ€¦.. Anyway, we asked if the hotel courtesy car would take us to the Pier the next morning. He said the car was not big enough for us and our luggageâ€¦.we were shockedâ€¦.because the hotel uses a Town Carâ€¦.canâ€™t get much bigger than that and we only had carry on luggage! Then he said the pier was too far away. We were totally frustrated by this point and said that in lieu of the problems we had encountered, it was the least he could do. He finally agreed to transportation. BTW, the pier is within the two mile driving range. Lesson learned! If you want a luxury hotel with luxury service, stay at the Four Seasons!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves It's 5 Star Rating!”
Reviews.Author: syrahgirl
Reviews.Content: Wow, this place is truly amazing. I have wanted to stay here for about 5 years and when I saw the Executive Suite room being offered on Expedia for $169/night this was too good to pass up. We stayed at this hotel for two nights, I could live here. From the moment we checked in, we were treated like royalty at this 5 star hotel in downtown Seattle. Check in went very smoothly, we arrived late, after a 15 hour drive and had dinner ressies at Etta's, our town car driver took us there and was very prompt when we wanted to be picked up. The town cars are 2009 Lexus, very plush and the driver's very professional and knowledgeable about the Seattle area. Our room was beautiful with a huge bathtub, marble on the floors, granite countertops, a nice sitting room and a very comfy bed. The room was very elegant and classy. The next morning we enjoyed breakfast at The Georgian, the hotel's fine dining restaurant, it is beautiful and elegant, also. The rooms is very spacious and the food wonderful. After some time in Mt. Vernon, we returned to the hotel to relax before a nice dinner at Union, our town car driver was very nice and picked us up and took us to the Space Needle where we enjoyed seeing the city lights at night. Just a quick call and the town car was there within minutes. After a nice breakfast at Cafe Campagne near the market we enjoyed the fitness facilities at the Fairmont, this is a truly gorgeous area with an atrium indoor pool, very spacious jacuzzi, two outdoor decks for relaxing and great weight equipment. We relaxed here for a couple of hours and the front desk was great about giving us an hour extension on our check out. I loved the pool area at this hotel, the housekeeping staff was excellent about keeping the area clean and everything was promptly picked up as guests left the area. Check out went smoothly and our town car driver took us to the Ride the Ducks Tour by the Space Needle, they also were very nice about picking us up after the tour and taking us back to the hotel. This is now one of my favorite hotels to stay in on the West Coast, we will definitely return again and again to this Grand Dame in Seattle. It has most certainly earned it's 5 star rating in all areas.

Reviews.Title: “Easily the best of three Seattle hotels we stayed at”
Reviews.Author: andrew02459
Reviews.Content: Due to a conference, friends and travel we stayed at three hotels during our 10 days in Seattle. This Fairmont is easily one of the nicest in the chain and we think has the best dining room of the 25 or 30 Fairmonts we've stayed in throughout US and Canada. We had a large two room suite and fine though smallish bath. All fixtures and equipment were the latest (flat screen tvs, e.g.). The oyster/fish resto Shuckers was fantastic as was dinner in the main dining room. Staff were wonderfully helpful and arranged breakfast specially for us when we needed an early morning departure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel but the breakfast choices.....”
Reviews.Author: barryfox
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in the hotel and took a suite because room prices were so reasonable. The hotel was perfect, the staff superlative and the room and bed divine but the choice at breakfast was distinctly underwhelming for the 5 star rating and the price. Maybe this was because of a reduced service over the memorial holiday weekend but that doesn't excuse it and it certainly didn't match up to other Fairmont hotels. Can't overstress how good the hotel was in every other respect.

Reviews.Title: “classy hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travelmonkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at a corner room on the 10th floor at the very end of the hallway with a view of the buildings across the street and a little bit of the water. Everything in the room was pretty nice, really only a couple things i'd complain about, one of our bathrobes in the room was a bit worn-out and the tv needs to be upgraded. Staff was pretty friendly. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant/bar and they only had one item on the menu that was vegetarian other than salads. The fitness club has a pretty big hot tub area and sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Is it Time to Take a Diamond or Two from this 5-Diamond Rated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: myluvoftravel
Reviews.Content: I recently checked in to this 5-Diamond rated luxurious hotel for my one night in Seattle with much anticipation. I checked out the next day scratching my head as to how it is rated a 5-Diamond rated hotel and strongly beliveve based on my stay and room, it is at best a low rated 4 or a high rated 3 Diamond hotel. I was allowed an early check-in, which was much appreciated. Reception had only one staff member working, whom I will say was nice and pleasant. Upon exiting the elevator on my floor, first thing I see is an old dirty styrofoam coffee cup on the table. This raised a "red flag" with me immediately. The room itself was a bedroom with separate sitting area. The rate was quite good. Never knew 5-Diamond hotels dropped their rates this low. As for the room, this was where most all of the problems were. A missing blind slat in the sitting room window. Just happened to be the middle slat, so much for keeping the sun out. The slats themselves were filthy and four of the slats had a rust covering on them. The two pillows on the loveseat, one had lipstick stains, the other was dirty with black marks on it. These evidently had not been cleaned in sometime. Found change on the closet floor near the in-room safe. Guess housekeeping did not run a vacuum in there. The loveseat did have arm covers on them, which the chair definitely needed. The arms on the chair were almost black. You can definitely see the dirt against the yellow material of the chair. The desk chair had a sizable dried up blood or chocolate stain all over the seat. Then there was the refreshment area. Three nicely stacked Dean and Deluca candy bars, howerver, one was almost two months past the freshness date. In my opinion, totally unacceptable at any rated hotel. I am still trying to find the ice machines. This is still a big mystery to me. Absolutely no direction nor mention as to where to get ice. After all of this, I was beginning to wonder, what kind of room have I been placed into. The bed was very comfortable, the linens, duvet, pillows, etc, very nice and of quaility I would expect at a hotel of this caliber. The bathroom equally as nice. Although the toilet would not always flush right, would have to take the cover off to fix it, I just put up with it. The amenities in the bathroom were very nice, and the size of the bathroom itself was quite adequate. The towels were not of the highest quality, but they did their job. Room size was fine for me, and really liked being able to open the window to get some fresh air into the room. I did get a laugh though, when I saw the televisions in each room, as I actually own one just like it that is six years old. Now come on Fairmont, we can do better than that. Plenty of cable stations to watch if that is of interest to you. Went to enjoy the pool at the Spa/Fitness center. The young woman at the desk was a delight to meet--very cordial, helpful, willing to please the guest, but way overworked. Enjoyed the pool and hottub, clean, right temperature, and very relaxing. However, the men's locker room was nothing short of a pig sty. All the amenities expected at a 5-Diamond hotel, robes, shaving cream, deoderant, etc., etc., however, they had run out of many of the products. It honestly looked like this locker room had not been touched all day, and this was 5:00 pm. There were not that many people using the fitness center. A very big disappointment to encounter. To top it off, of the hundreds and hundreds of towels in this hotel, I just happen to be given a dirty one. I just laughed, and threw it in the dirty towel bin. I did inform the young lady who was most apologetic. It was not her fault. Utilized the concierege service who was most professional, helpful, and really went out of her way to try and find something of interest for me. Kudo's to her. Room service was outstanding. Food very good, delivered in a timely manner. Laundry service, again, what I would expect. The garments were returned when I was told they would be and in the condition I expected. The shoe shine service was equally as good. My pair of shoes had not looked that good in a very long time. A great job done. Had breakfast in the Georgian Room. Breakfast was very good, but nothing exceptional. Service was adequate, howerver, noticed a few guests did have some wait time before being seated. Did speak to the Manager on Duty regarding the above problems. My complaint was and still is that the Fairmont Olympic is a 5-Diamond rated hotel and naturally is very proud of this rating, but in my case, it sorely did not live up to it. All problems but one were rectified, breakfast was comped, had a nice platter of 5-chocolate covered strawberries delivered to my room while at the fitness center, howerver, no silverwear came with it, lucky to get a napkin I guess. I did check out of that room the next day with that "old" candy bar still sitting there. The entrance to the hotel is most inviting, the lobby and Georgian Room were grand, and very comfortable, the hallway looked very fresh. Staff was just adequate, with a few delivering the service expected of this hotel. In my honest opinion, I believe occupancy could be down, and staff has been cut back. Housekeeping Department may be rushed and just not able to tend to the details that should be looked at. That was the major problem, details that separate this hotel from others and especially a 5-Diamond rated one from even a 4-Diamond rated one. Service, cleanliness, and attention to detail very lacking here. It is also the only hotel of this caliber that I had to actually get the front door for myself on two different occasions. One time, there was no one out front. Only saw one bellman at all times while I was there. This hotel cannot live on past laurels and maintain its rating. Staffing really seems to be the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay when visting Seattle”
Reviews.Author: aa2452
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to find a good deal on hotels.com ($160/night), so we jumped at the chance to stay at the only 5 star hotel in Seattle. The room was spacious - a separate sitting room from the bedroom was a nice touch. Unfortunately, we were in a low floor, along side 5th Avenue and the morning traffic and busses were loud and disruptive. I also found the bed to be much too soft to be comfortable. But, on a positive side, the location was great - easy walk to Pike Place Market and Seattle Art Museum. Wireless internet connection was great. The fitness center's swimming pool was ridiculously shallow, but the jacuzzi and sauna were a great treat. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, but it wasn't anything to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: cellfree
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice room but on the busy street side. There was traffic noise and that was not particularly pleasant. That is the only negative comment. The concierge staff was one of the best I have ever experienced. Helpful from the time I made the reservation and competent with several requests made during my stay. Service at the hotel restaurant was good, food good (not out of sight) but served in a beautiful and quite setting. The service was impeccable. As a side note, we attended the 5th Street Theater for a performance and were pleasantly surprised both by the theater itself and the quality of the performance. Many might prefer to have a water view but I don't think that would enhance the Seattle experience enough to stay at another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised; hotel staff more interested in tips than service”
Reviews.Author: AffordableComfort
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Fairmont Seattle was quite disappointing. It started off poorly when upon arrival the bellman offered little help unloading luggage from our car - families traveling with young children will appreciate how frustrating that was. Nevertheless, he was all too eager to stand around expecting a tip as we finished the job ourselves. The check-in desk staff were unfriendly and did not make us feel welcome. We had made a point of booking a 1 bedroom suite because we were with our baby and everyone sleeps better in different rooms. Unfortunately the so-called "suite" consisted of a bedroom separated by french doors - not a problem until we realized that the french doors had no glass in the frames! It would have been funny had it not resulted in two very poor nights of rest. The hotel's redeeming aspect is its very central location... I suppose it is not surprising that the staff here are used to catering to their core business clientele and seem to view the weekend leisure guests as a necessary inconvenience. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Deeply Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: lemons1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the suggestion of a friend who uses it often. Found a good rate on a discount website and did three days over a weekend. Large corner room with three windows (that opened!), very quiet, all amenities you'd expect at somewhere like the Ritz but without the stiffness. As our pal said, this is a lovely staff, warm and pleasant helpful. Excellent bed and nice linens, heavy bathrobes, comfortable armchair with an ottoman. Central location near the art museum, the Koolhaas library, and about a 5 block walk to Pike Place Market. We did not have a car, but our pal usually parks in another garage the next block south and finds it less expensive. And a great recommendation for the bakery-cafe on the ground floor on the west side; fabulous pastry and coffee as good as you'd expect in Seattle. I can't tell you when I've been as happy with a hotel as this one.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: luxuryholidayqueen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the kids end of March - we had a large executive suite which had a separate master bedroom. The kids had the sofa and an additional roll away in the living area with their own tv which they loved. The suite was immaculate, the staff all very friendly and courteous and the location couldnt have been any better. Bed was VERY comfortable and the room was very quiet. The pool facilities were superb and very clean. Overall a super hotel, super location, super city!. Will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeattletravellerUW
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my anniversary last year and loved every minute of it. The spacious rooms are decorated with elegant antique furniture and beautiful chandeliers and lamps. The beds are super comfortable and the bathrooms were clean with wonderful showers. The lobby was beautiful and picture-perfect. I have attended a Christmas party here before and it was very elegant. Around Christmas the lobby is decorated with gorgeous trees and festive decor. The location is a little further from shopping than I'd like to walk, but it is conveniently located near the financial district. Shucker's restaurant on the lower level has amazing seafood. I would recommend eating lunch here instead of dinner to save a few bucks. Many of the area restaurants cater to business-travellers so they are closed on weekends. I would recommen Purple Cafe & Wine Bar a few blocks away for a nice lunch with a huge variety of wines, and Tulio Italian Restaurant for a great dinner. Parking is valet only and is a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Your classy grandmother's hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickChicago
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a nice location. I would recommend for people over the age of 40. We had gift certificates for two nights and found the hotel nice. It does need a renovation though... no flat screen tv, a hole in the couch and the carpet is a bit worn. If you are under the age of 40 and want something hipper, the Hilton and Sheraton are just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Elegance at The Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: sara09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Fairmont over Valentine's/President's Day weekend and loved every minute of it. The hotel is elegant in the traditional sense - understated, not over the top like The Fairmont in San Francisco. Our room was good-sized and well laid-out. And the bed! One of the most comfortable I have ever slept in! Loved the white marble in the bathroom. My only criticism was that the curtains were a little too flowery - traditional decor can become old lady with too many flowers. The hotel has a wonderful gym with a view over the indoor pool and beautiful arched windows. We appreciated the very fast, and free, Internet service. The hotel staff was attentive, but not overly. Dinner at Shuckers was amazing, and they had the best oysters we tried in Seattle - and we ate them at quite a few different places. The hotel is well-located downtown, and we could walk to everything except Fremont. Would definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Old, but in a good way”
Reviews.Author: Falcon123Seattle
Reviews.Content: We stay here a lot but my most recent time was probably the best. Well, here are my pros and cons. Pros- Pool/fitness center is small but relaxing. Pool is kid friendly because it has pool toys. Rooms are big and clean. Old, but in a good way. Very helpful staff. Cons- Pancakes there are really dry. Elevators are small and slow. Try not to order room service or eat at one of their restaurants. Food quality is good but it is super EXPENSIVE!! Bottom line: Service and staff are amazing but everything is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovefur
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great service( except for the bartender Sunday night who was a bit abrubt and impatient when i was deciding on my drink). We made the reservation in person while staying at another Seattle location and got a great deal. Executive suite with 2 twin beds for $299 with a $100 Visa gift card! Well appointed suite but no coffee maker in room. Hotel did provide a tea kettle at no charge when requested. Comfortable beds. Could hear traffic, even from the 10th floor though. Woke me up in the AM but I am a light sleeper anyway. Could hear some noise from adjacent rooms but not much. Doorman was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve Retreat”
Reviews.Author: JustaTravler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Olympic Hotel in Seattle on New Year's Eve so as to avoid exorburant cab fees back to the suburbs. We were really impressed with the high quality of service during check-in, which was a breeze. The room was a King Suite with one of the most comfortable beds I've slept on in a hotel in a long while. The room was well appointed and spacious. We had a enough room to pop a bottle of champagne and relax before going out on the town. The on-site food was extremely expensive, however there are a lot of other food options in the near vincinity...we walked across the street to Beni Hana's for a fantastic meal. Unfortunately, the room's mini-bar fridge is not ideal for storing left overs. Check with the front desk for a fridge. Be advised that the demographic we observed at this hotel is 50+, so if you're in for a more relaxed, slower-paced environment...this is the place. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Fairmont Olympic”
Reviews.Author: Traveldanse
Reviews.Content: I booked a sport event special price and let them know I was celebrating my birthday with this trip. Staff/Service was outstanding. They remembered my birthday and honored all requests. Room service was overpriced, but again the service was outstanding and the food was excellent. Room was comfortable, a little on the plain side, but roomy and amply and elegantly furnished. Lobby was beautiful, but entrances were confusing. Airport shuttle bus pickup spot was moved from the Fairmont to several blocks away and had to haul my suitcase through the snow. (Unusual storm for the area really wreaked havoc.) Missed the first bus as it did not stop where the concierge told me it would stop. I blame that on the shuttle company, but then a 5 diamond might offer airport shuttle...and the concierge was very hard to reach in the morning. Short staffed due to storm? Toilet seat on crooked. Overall I had a very nice birthday stay and for a similar price, would stay there again. Very good downtown location and great amenities. I enjoyed the atmosphere and appreciate their reaching out to several types of guests.

Reviews.Title: “Historical hotel with old world flair, top notch staff.”
Reviews.Author: advcardio
Reviews.Content: We booked with Fairmont website as they advertised the rate of $150.00 US per night, which for this grand old hotel was a very good rate over the Thanksgiving weekend. Even though the main entrance is located on the street level you need to take either the escalator or elevator up to the check in lobby/desk. Check in was quick and accurate. My special request to have a small extra fridge and a inroom coffee maker was honoured without charge, a hotel perk. Check out was just as easy with no surprise charges or special fees on the bill. Parking is not within the hotel but across the street behind the hotel or you can have valet parking for 32.00 per night. **TIP** Street parking is free in the evening as we parked our car right in front of the hotel for 2 nights. The room offered plenty of space and light. You can open your window (1 foot) to get some fresh air. Fairmont hotels offer green choices including a recycle waste basket. The only downside to our stay was the beds which were old, soft and saggy and the old clunky television. The washrooms were well appointed with an excellent showerhead power. The towels were in good quality and soft as were the robes and slippers. The gym is an oasis with cozy change rooms and lockers. They offer a large jacuzzi but a small pool with a lane open for lap swimming. The pool was quiet at night with a glass roof and the low lights made for a relaxing swim. The gym has 2 areas one for weights and the other for aerobics equipment (bike, treadmills etc) The bikes and treadmills had individual tv's and 2 staff members available all times. The stars of this hotel should be noted, the top notch proffesional staff and EVERY single time we had a conversation with them (reservation, room service, front desk, housekeeping, gym and others) they smiled and said "Would there be anything else we can do for you?" The staff are well trained in guest services. The hotel is located in the hub of downtown Seattle in a safe area to walk around. Many nooks and crannies to explore in this architecture delight. If the rate is right we would return but would like to see them replace the beds and tv .

Reviews.Title: “OMG this place needs to be updated in their rooms”
Reviews.Author: MalcolmSuperstar
Reviews.Content: i booked the night before Friday October 11th 2008 after 6:20pm pacific time on Hotels.ca I've used Hotels.ca lots for Florida and always got lucky with last minute lowest rates. we got it for $239 canadian taxes included. We were coming from Vancouver Canada by car. The Valet service is the best, its true what they say about these guys. The whole experience per say with service was unbeleiveable. This staff is teh best i've come across. If it wasn't for the suites and rooms needing a total new uplift, i would have gien this hotel a 6 Star rating. We were upgraded from a executive suite to a Deluxe Executive suite. Holy S***!, huge room with a living room and big bathroom. This place is extremely clean. Probably the cleanest hotel and its rooms that i have ever saw. The problem is the furniture is so old, something you would see maybe at a second hand antique store or Sally ann store, but in good shape. Saddly the carpets had slight ripple and was not in style.. I found everything to be in the 80's style with the furniture being early 70's. The bath tub is the lowest i have saw.. Really , its so low don't expect a deep soaker tub which i would have expected from this hotel. The toilet was so low to the ground, i needed a handle which wasn;t provided. I'am in my late 30's , great shape and found an inconvenience. I feel really bad the decor is mostly suited for those over 70 years old but lack handicap accessories found in European and Canadian Hotels. Yes you do get CBC from Canada on the old 26 inch panasonic tv, but the picture quality is less than digital with fuzz snow in every channel. The hide-a-bed in the sofa had a sink in the middle. Our teenagers complain of this. Our king size Mattress was so stiff, i kept twisting and turning all night. Everything felt and smelled clean. But the bed, the curtains(GOD UGLY), old tv sets, toilet, bathtub, carpets, french doors, thermostat all need to be modernized and improved to a high standard. The door knobs where worn off from the brass, the french doors had no glass, just see thru curtains from the seating room to the bedroom. as to the noise, I was on the 10th floor. I could hear all the traffic outside and someone yelling on the street. Its true , there is no view anywhere in this building. You are surrounded by newly built highrises way taller than 12 stories..lol as to distance to the shopping district and Pike Market where they throw the salmon. You are really close but far away from teh crowds. about a 15 minute walk. I was thinking before booking Fairmount Olympic Hotel to book the Sheraton. But the Sheraton and Westin in Florida really suck and over price for the dumps they own! BUt seeing the Sheraton, I would definitely book the Sheraton. It looks newer, beautifully decorated, really what a new hotel should look like and lots of stagette parties. Convenently located to everything and priced moderately. next time, it will be the Sheraton or the Pan Pacific. by the way valet parking in Seattle is $30 , at the Fairmount its $35. beleive it or not , its much cheaper to the the valet than using the public pay parking where they charge you $11 for a 90 minutes parking. Also everything is Seattle is overpriced to any other big city. It has no real good restaurants and all are over-rated and overpriced. But We did enjoy the TapHouse. Seattle is the most unfriendly City and a dunGY ugly city. I take cruises every year or Royal carribean and Princess and travel to many huge metropolitan cities. Seattle is the bottom of the list for restaurants and thinsg to do. IF your on a budget but still want a nice place, but don't want to pay a fortune but still stay close to Seattle. I would recommend anything in Everett washington that is close to Seattle. a few minutes on the I-5 interstate. Honestly! if you like my post.. please score me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: VIVA_WORLD
Reviews.Content: Wedding Blissâ€¦. My good friend got married in June. The reception and overnight guests were booked at the Arctic Club, a new hotel in Seattle. The Arctic Club was not ready to open in time for the reception so they moved us all to the Fairmount. What a treat!! The building was just beautiful, and well maintained. The rooms were small suites with a nice sitting area with a couch, 2 chairs, desk/chair (with a recycle bin, only in Seattle), TV, large closet and dresser. A separate bedroom was equipped with a king size bed, TV, and bathroom. We got to use terrycloth robes, and slippers, and expensive toiletries. I loved the lobby lounge, where we were able to sip on cocktails, munch on appetizers, and listen to the pianist tap out perfect tunes to make you feel like youâ€™ve stepped back in time. I have never had the opportunity to stay in such a historical hotel, and would definitely do it again. One last thing I would like to point out. The lobby was beautifully decorated with large bouquets of live flowers, one huge one in the middle. Unfortunately, I am severely allergic to Tiger Lilyâ€™s (one of my favorite flowers) and the huge bouquet in the middle of the room was filled with them. As I was waiting to check-in my throat began to swell. I was 4th in line to check-in, and knew that would be too long, so I snuck around to the VIP check-in (separate area) and explained my situation to the gentlemen who was happy to assist me there and quickly checked me into my room. What Service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Why would anyone stay anywhere else????”
Reviews.Author: PortiaD
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing short of wonderful. Why would anyone ever stay anywhere else. The service was fantastic...from a bed turn down at night, complete with bottles of cool water on each side of our bed along with slippers laid out for us.......to the valet who brought our car around as we were about to leave and asked inf we would like bottles of water for our trip home.......everything during our entire stay was all about service. The fitness centre and pool/spa area were filled with amenities and each treadmill had its own flat screen t.v. The waiter at the restaurant greeted us by name and every time we left the table, he was there within 30 seconds to refold our napkin....just entirely too impressive. We used to be Marriott people but after this trip - we are definitely going to be choosing the Fairmont Hotels over any other. Join the Presidents Club prior to visiting this hotel and start moving up in the Fairmont World.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Choice in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: TravelRevue
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Fairmont Olympic as part of a business event at the hotel in April. Rooms were very nice. King bed had excellent bedding and was very comfortable. Lots of room and included a desk, minibar, big closet and comfortable chair/ottoman. Bathrooms were nice, if a bit small, for this quality of hotel. All events that were a part of the business meeting were top notch, with great service, excellent food and plenty of choice. Facilities were very nice as well, especially the Garden Room, which was really beautiful and a great space for a large group dinner. Location is good for the Seattle business visitor or the tourist as itâ€™s close to everything and only a short taxicab from neighborhoods like Belltown or the sports facilities. I really liked that there was a Brooks Brothers around the corner for a quick tie purchase when I realized I hadnâ€™t packed an extra. I would definitely consider the Fairmont for future stays in Seattle, although I would probably be more likely to stay at the Grand Hyatt Seattle. Both are excellent properties and the choice would really come down to personal preference. The Fairmont is a grand, traditional hotel, while the Grand Hyatt is a sleeker, modern property. Either way, you canâ€™t go wrong at the Fairmont Olympic if youâ€™re in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Upscale Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mood
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this upscale hotel. We stayed for a wedding held in the hotel and the staff was extremely attentive. The room was clean and the wonderful comfortable bedding made the stay excellent. We ordered room service the night we arrived and it was promptly served and was delicious. The hotel is in a good location and the area is pleasant to walk to many of the sites. We were happy with our stay and would recommend it if anyone needs to stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to see how the other half lives :-)”
Reviews.Author: mohicans
Reviews.Content: We are not Fairmont sort of people - we tend to fit in at the Comfort Inn & Suites - however we did decide to splurge for our last two nights in Seattle and stay at the Fairmont Olympic - and it was really lovely. The valet parking was efficient and friendly - those guys outside are the hotel's best ambassadors! The check in was efficient - and although the elevators are quite small as another person mentioned, they were really, really fast so our waits were not so bad. We had 3 meals in the Georgian - 2 breakfasts and 1 dinner. For breakfast - we would recommend the Banana & Strawberry French Toast - forget about the calories and order it - its an amazing dish. The dinner we had was probably the most elegant of any we have had - ever -- and we can't say how it would compare to other spendy restaurants, but we did enjoy it - and were made to feel very comfortable in their dining room. We had a suite on the 7th floor - no view, but when you look out the window you see hundreds of other rooms without a view, so you are not alone. The room was nicely decorated, spacey - especially the bathroom - and truly comfortable. Thanks to this hotel for having CBC available on their TV - we got to stay in touch with the Olympics while there, and didn't miss anything! The pool and fitness area is divine - and if we return, we will spend far more time there. We found Seattle to be a great shopping city - and within walking distance are some great shops - Coach, Nordstroms etc. We left our mark there too :-) My only niggle was room service - it wasn't so good. I ordered fish & chips and expected it to be the "best fish & chips ever". It wasn't. It tasted like any old room service dish from any old Sheraton or Holiday Inn - and cost twice as much. For us, this was a treat - now we go back to our middle class lives and enjoy our memories. We'd love to do this again - and maybe we will someday!

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MisstheDogs
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a beautiful, older (but modernized) hotel in a prime Seattle location. The hotel is walking distance from most city sights, including the waterfront, aquarium, shopping, Market and many more. The lobby is old-style, large and comfortable, with oriental rugs, lots of wood, etc. Check-in was quick. Getting to the room -- not so quick. The hotel has four, quite small and quite slow elevators, one or more of which was almost always out of order in the two days we stayed there. Thus, at peak times such as mornings and dinner-time, there was a 5-10 minute wait. And, when the elevator finally did arrive, it was filled, because it only holds 5-6 people, without luggage. With luggage, it's crowded with 3. Our room was disappointing. Knowing that older hotels have a hodgepodge of rooms, many of which are smaller than modern hotels, I didn't expect much. Still the room was VERY small with no view. Queen bed. Only one chair -- thus, one of us had to sit on the bed to watch the very small TV. Of course, because the chair and bed were directly opposite (and the room was too small to move the chair next to the bed), we both could not watch TV at the same time w/o craning our necks. There was almost no place on the floor to put our suitcases and we ended up tripping over them. Room decor was ok -- not memorable -- and bed was comfortable. The A/C worked well and I believe there was a mini-bar (didn't use it). However, the room was so small that we didn't want to do anything there but sleep. The bathroom, by contrast, was a good size with lots of marble and nice amenities. Rooms were very well-insulated and there is an in-room safe. Wakeup call was timely and staff was very friendly. The concierge desk was well-manned and provided excellent suggestions. We tried the hotel restaurant for breakfast. The food was good and served fairly promptly. Cost was about what you'd expect for a high-end hotel. Workout room was modern and there was plenty of staff to assist. Overall, the stay was ok but, if coming again, for the same price I'd stay down the street at the Hotel Monaco or just try another hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “From a family with a toddler”
Reviews.Author: zeppgirl
Reviews.Content: We just came back from one night here while stopping through Seattle. The price wasn't too bad with the AAA rate of $312/night, though for that price I have high expectations. First arriving, we were greeted by the valet attendants and these guys were all very friendly/helpful. They get 5 stars from me!! We didn't have to wait in line to check in, which was nice. However, the one negative for me was that they said our luggage would be right up and we were supposed to have a crib in our room since it was noted with our reservation and I called a week before to comfirm. The crib wasn't there so I called downstairs and they brought it up. The crib ended up looking very nice and we also got some baby toiletries with it. After waiting for our luggage 20 minutes, I called again and it was brought to our room. This normally isn't a big deal but we did have to wait for it for going out. The room we were in on the fifth floor, 534 did look out with the pool right below us, so if possible, request something away from there. It had a suite with a tv, bedroom, large closet area and bathroom. Everything looked beautiful in marble, the hotel is beautiful too and fancy and is centrally located for the pike's place market (several blocks away walking). If you want to get to the seattle center you will have to take another mode of transportation, as it's too far to walk, but there is a bus stop and monorail stop a few blocks from the hotel. There is also a benihanna's on the next block, which I recommend. Our toddler loved it(:

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars”
Reviews.Author: dentgal
Reviews.Content: I just arrived home from 5 days at the fairmont olympic hotel in seattle and i would have been content to move in their permanently! i was fortunate to be booked in on a convention rate ($250 per night--and they didn't have the basic room for 5 nights so for $25 more i had a suite!).....that is $25 well spent!! i had a huge king sized bed and a separate living room with sofa, 2 overstuffed pillows to rest my head after a day of shopping, a desk, chair and 2 tvs.....there is a separate dressing area and the bathroom was nice with 2 robes to use..... the hotel is first class all the way....the staff cannot do enough for you!! i had requested a coffee maker, which for some reason the fairmont does not provide.....when i checked in, there was no coffee maker in the room, so i phoned the front desk.....the head of catering told me that he would get one for me, even if he had to buy it himself.....sure enough, within 1/2 hour they brought me a coffee maker on a silver platter with all the acoutrements!! i was very impressed.....the doormen greet you when you leave the premises and when you return--a nice touch!! coffee and tea is served in the lobby in the early morning.....the carpet is starting to look a bit dated in the halls, but that would be my only complaint--and a small price to pay for a marvellous hotel.......i can't wait to stay on the "gold floor" on the fairmont in boston--where i am going in 1 week!! by the way, seattle is a great city for shopping! it is small--all of the shops are within a 2 block radius--macy's, nordstroms, brooks brothers, coach, yves st laurent, etc. etc.! heaven for this visitor from canada!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kitty55
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Olympic is a beautiful historic building with a central location in downtown Seattle. My daughter and I arrived just after noon for our two night stay, and our room was ready. Although it was on the small side, it was very comfortable with two (long) twin beds, a chair/ottoman, TV armoire (with minibar), desk/chair, and fairly large closet with safe. The bathroom looked recently renovated and sparkled, it was so clean. Toiletries, robes and slippers were provided. The hotel has excellent service. Everyone greeted us by name after the first introduction, and the concierge staff was extremely helpful. The phone calls I made were answered on the first ring, and with the greeting "Good day/evening, Mrs. xxx, how may I assist you?" One of the hotel amenities is complimentary coffee in the lobby every morning, but I prefer having it in my room while getting ready. Since no coffeemakers were available, room service delivered a lovely coffee tray free of charge both mornings. The only negative is that we were only on the third floor and the street noise was pretty bad. Since I was so tired the first night, I didnâ€™t really notice it that much until around 6am when I was awakened by garbage trucks (or something very noisy) and couldnâ€™t get back to sleep. I would have requested a room change, but needed to get up at 6am the next day anyway, so figured it would be ok. Unfortunately that night something woke me up around 2am (sirens?) and I couldnâ€™t get back to sleep at all. I mentioned this to the doorman as we left, and he said they would be addressing the noise issue with an upcoming renovation. I booked the room via our corporate travel, so got it for a really good price -- the rack rate is a bit over my normal budget! I would not hesitate to stay there again but would make sure to get a higher floor and/or interior facing room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay ...”
Reviews.Author: _de_last_one
Reviews.Content: Being a grand dame of this city, I was expecting a nice property and happy to announce that we had a good stay for the remaining weekend while in Seattle. We had just returned from Olympic National Park and so it was a very pleasant experience when checking into this hotel. The staff were very professional (the front desk more so than the concierge). See photos for the executive suite (bathrooms had been updated and I like the simple classic European design, very fitting for this hotel) The gym feels like a sauna (due to it being July and this is one of the hottest week in recent history supposedly) as it is by the pool (yes the equipment are all lined up along the sides and all over). If it isnt that humid and warm, we would have enjoyed it. Location of the hotel is perfect for any tourists, right in the shopping belt and so close to Pike's Place. It is definitely more central (the week before we had stayed at the Marriott Waterfront) Overall, we would return but there are too many cool new and chic hotels (esp. the boutique ones) in this town.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: shanesmom1647
Reviews.Content: Got an excellent deal thru Expedia on this hotel. Arrival: confusion, bellhop spoke broken english, they asked if we wanted them to take all our bags up to our room, it was confusing and awkward so we just did it ourselves. They didn't help us getting luggage loaded onto the carts. I think they should just do it, not ask! We had a lot of stuff. Check-in: smooth. No problems. Our room was near the health club though on the 2nd floor and there was a strong odor of chlorine. We asked to be moved immediately. Had to wait about 20 minutes for someone to show up and take us to the 4th floor. Our new room had view of the harbor (partial view). Room: Our AC didn't work properly. 1st night miserable. They offered to move us but they had someone try to fix it the 2nd day and it was a little better but still warm. We decided not to move. We had a nice king bed, very comfy, nice linens. Rug in the room and hallways needs replaced but we still went barefoot (it wasn't THAT bad!). Nice marble floors in bathroom, nice shower, granite countertops, nice magnifier mirror on the wall, a nice amenity! tip: bring your own shampoo & conditioner and soap. The hotel supplied products are pretty bad (cheap). ELEVATORS! Wow. Hope they have been repaired since we were there. The wait to go down took forever. We ended up using stairs most the time. Overall appearance the hotel is beautiful, lobby is beautiful, friendly staff. I thought complimentary coffee would be nice for the guests. There is no coffeemaker in the room. There is a nice coffee/espresso shop on the street level. They have fabulous looking sweets. Cappuccinos are delicious. Just wish we had coffee in the room. Room was quiet, no noise from neighbors, hall, just occasional street noise but we had our window open because the AC broke and we shut it off and opened the window.

Reviews.Title: “Significant deterioration...”
Reviews.Author: nappieb
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel many times back in the days when it was the "Four Seasons Olympic". My spouse and I recently had the misfortune to stay there again under its new (Fairmont) sponsorship. We arrived around 10 pm only to find that the room we had booked through American Express (and gauranteed for late arrival!) had been given away to a guest who had arrived earlier. The desk clerk DOWNGRADED us at the same price we had paid for the superior room that he had given away earlier! We complained to American Express who apparently caused a stink with the asst. manager who grudgingly offered to move us to our original room the next day with a $30 credit for the night we arrived. We declined the asst, manager's offer because we didn't want to stay around to monitor our luggage during the move and we were staying for only 36 hours anyway. We took the credit instead for 2 nights. At our age and after all we've been through, we weren't keen to stay in a below-par room, credit or no credit, but there was nothing we could do without destroying our leisure time the next day! Apart from the bad check-in experience, contacting room service was difficult with many minutes spent on "hold". Some more experienced staff would be in order... and fewer shyster practices! I've been traveling on business for over 40 years and so I know that hotels routinely give away their best rooms (even the GAURANTEED ONES!!!) if it appears that the guest may be a "no-show". Knowing that we would be a late arrival, I deliberately chose the Fairmont based on my earlier experiences from when this hotel was under the Four Seasons banner. I'll never stay at the Fairmont again!! If we had want to subject ourselves to the shoddiest practices of the lodging industry we would have stayed at a cut price motel. At least they smile when they're ripping you off!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance at its finest”
Reviews.Author: dforce
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Olympic is an absolute gem in Seattle. The hotel staff are extremely professional. There is an atmosphere of elegance and the building's architecture is magnificent. I felt like I was at a meeting of important dignitaries and the Fairmont staff always treat you like a VIP. I absolutely adored my room. Although smaller than other rooms I have had at Fairmont properties, it was too cozy to resist. An added bonus is the complimentary overnight shoe shine service which was incredibly convenient and unexpected. They also include a CD player in the room with some nice Fairmont jazz tunes. This was one of my favourite stays at a Fairmont property. I will definitely be returning. Also, for breakfast, try the French cafe just around the corner of the hotel. There is also a great Japanese Teppenyaki restaurant less than a block away. The hotel is a little out of the way of attractions such as the space needle but the concierge staff are very helpful. Be sure to ride the ducks when you are in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: cbabeej
Reviews.Content: We've lived in the Seattle area all our lives and this hotel is an original classic I've always wanted to stay at. We finally splurged and spent a night here and it was perfect in every way! This is an old hotel but immaculent & pristine! The lobby area is gorgeous, with incredible, winding staircases to an upper loggia surrounding the lobby. The restaurant is gorgeous...the room was gorgeous and impeccably clean. The bed and linens were to die for! The service was outstanding. The location is perfect for getting anywhere around downtown. We travel constantly, and stay in Seattle an average of once every two weeks, so as an experienced traveler I can honestly say this hotel is perfection in all ways (well, unless you're looking for affordable :) We were actually in town to visit my father-in-law in the hospital, so we didn't really get to spend much time enjoying the hotel, but will get back to do so ASAP. I can't recommend the Fairmont Olympic enough!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: berkwilliam
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Fairmont. The location and service are second to none. You are within walking distance to Pike's Place Market and many other great attractions in Seattle. The concierge staff can not do enough for you. The beautiful lobby is a great place to have a cocktail before heading out to dinner. The hotel restaurant, Shucker's, has excellent seafood, although it is pricey, it was wonderful. One of the best features is the health club and georgeous indoor pool. I did not find any of the issues other reviewers mentioned. Everything was just about perfect. But realize that you are not heading to a five-star Vegas property such as the Bellagio, or to a newer boutique hotel. You are taking a step back in time to a classic - a well-maintained and classically elegant hotel from a different era. With the right expectations in mind, you won't be disappointed. There is so much to see and do in Seattle and the Fairmont was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional comfort and warm service”
Reviews.Author: YVR_guestservices
Reviews.Content: We booked in for a one-night stay at the Olympic after I had minor surgery in Seattle. Full disclosure here- I work in a hotel myself (not a Fairmont), so I am inclined to be forgiving of little things that go wrong; and we are low-maintenance travellers anyway so our needs are quite basic. That said, we greatly enjoyed every minute of our stay at the Olympic. Danny, the doorman went way, way out of his way to welcome us. I mean literally went out of his way - he walked me all the way to the escalators leading up to the lobby. From Adam on the front desk, we received a gracious welcome and keys to room 1007. This suite doesn't have what most people would consider a "view", but given the very good rate we received, and knowing that you can't have stunning views in 100% of your rooms, I loved it. It's a long rectangle with three windows on the long side, so the late-afternoon light was beautiful. Boom - I'm sold right there. But I actually liked the view out over the rooftops into the city, especially the modern pre-fab house on exhibit on the roof of the building across the street.Two comfy armchairs, two side chairs, king bed, vast bathroom. Robert, the houseman, arrived shortly after we entered with our requested pillows - enough for our little dog to build herself a fine little nest while we were out. Speaking of which, they brought silver dishes on a silver tray with a linen cover for her to eat from. Since I couldn't really go out after my operation, we decided to order in from room service and enjoy a movie. I'm maybe the only person on the planet who doesn't really like room service; I like eating at a table with other people to watch, and room service food, it seems, is never at the right temperature. But that night we had the best room-service meal ever - a beautiful piece of salmon, buttermilk-fried chicken with biscuits, all of it piping hot. It was easily as good as a restaurant meal, with the added perk of getting to eat in a comfy hotel bathrobe and slippers. The bed was gorgeously comfortable with sparklingly-clean linens and a thick duvet. We decided to get an early start back in the morning and were pleased when the remote check-out service via TV presented an accurate, up-to-date folio and was easy to use. When we arrived at the arcade level to retrieve our car from valet parking, we found it waiting, doors and trunk open, with a bag containing milk and cookies for the trip home - nice touch. The doorman on duty, They(sp?) also brought some chilled bottled water. Given that the door/bell staff are both the first and the last contact with the hotel that guests will have, they have a lot of power to create a favourable impression and it's quite obvious that John, They and their team take that responsibility very seriously. We truly felt like highly-valued repeat guests whom they knew well, and they couldn't have been more helpful. Between the room, the food, and the kind service, we absolutely felt we got the perfect Fairmont experience from this stay. We certainly will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Five Diamond Property Image Fell Apart”
Reviews.Author: TRUTravel
Reviews.Content: I had extremely high hopes of this "Landmark" hotel and its reputed five diamond status but unfortunately All of the 5 diamond image fell apart in a 24 hrs: Some of the main problems that we had were: - the room was very dusty. Under the cooling unit, you could see layers of dust -the bathroom phone was so dirty you could see it from a distance -the tap/faucet was leaking - our registration/payment was done through our conference agent and was never received. -The room was VERY small - If we asked for anything it look HOURS to arrive - I asked for slippers and they arrived the next day and after 4 phone calls - Restaurant in town recommended by Concierge was a bad one Good Stuff: -Friendly staff -Nice House Car -Excellent location and lobby -Amazing fitness centre

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience”
Reviews.Author: LML4400
Reviews.Content: The rooms are fabulous...very "Fairmont" great beds, big bathrooms and large sleeping rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: falk-wulf
Reviews.Content: Perfect and very consistent 5 star experience. Particularly the staff performed without any glitches. You have to like the classical ambiente though.

Reviews.Title: “True Excellence”
Reviews.Author: PaintTheCity
Reviews.Content: If I had to rate this hotel and staff on a scale of 1 to 10, I'm giving it a 20. Excellence in EVERYTHING. Hoorah. It's worth every penny spent. I'll certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Classic charm”
Reviews.Author: Nick_From_Manchester
Reviews.Content: Having spent the previous night in the W across the street, this hotel was a complete opposite in terms of it's furnishings. The candid photos (by others) do a great job in displaying the traditional classic floral decoration of the rooms, with comfy sofas in lieu of trendy cushion seats. All the usual amenities that you would expect from this class of hotel, but in a more sumptous format: high count cotton bed sheets, robes and slippers in the bathroom, quality toiletries, expensive mini-bar, safe, non-plasma TV, CD player etc. The shower was over the bath (prefer a separate unit) and the bathroom itself a little small, but the large bedroom (had upgraded to an executive room) made up for this. Nice touches like an umbrella in the wardrobe and friendly staff, made the place feel homely. The hotel is looking very slightly tired in some areas, but these large vast traditional places must take some upkeep. Views from the rooms are poor, as the hotel is surrounded by other large buildings on all sides. In summary, if you want trendy and modern go to the W, but if its classic sumptous comfort you desire, this is the place. Oh and try to get a high floor, away from the city noise below.

Reviews.Title: “Classic but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: entrad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a medical meeting. Did not start out well, as, though I had a reserved an Executive King Suite, they warned me that "the only one they had left was on the 2nd floor" (near health club and street noise), despite the fact that I heard them giving the traveler next to me at check-in an upgrade to a suite on the tenth floor. I opted for a deluxe room on the 6th floor. The room was well appointed, medium sized and generally comfortable, if a notch below Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton levels in finishes and level of upkeep. The other major problem I had was that my key card kept deactivating - I literally ended up at reception at least once a day during my 5 days there to have it re-keyed. They suggested that it might have something to do with my cellphone, but I kept it in different places and it was clear to me that it was being deactivated by the hotel. Otherwise, the service was good, health club was attractive, food was so-so, though there are lots of great food options nearby (Purple and Wild Ginger stood out). One other minor complaint - coffeemaker (they have those nice single cup pod ones these days) in room would have been really nice, though they have complimentary coffee in health club and lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Seattle”
Reviews.Author: redheadedangel41
Reviews.Content: We are in seattle for 3 weeks due to my husband's work. So the Fairmont is the first of 3 reviews that will appear.
